rComments: Dr. Whissell gave organized lectures that were easy to follow and explained the biology and psychology aspects of meditation very clearly. I really like the study notes he prepared for us to review before exams. He always encourages us to ask questions and are very accessible through emails or in his office hours. He really cares about students!

One of my top professors at UofT! I had him for NEW200 too. His lectures are clear and he includes funny, personal stories that really engage his students and make his lessons more interesting and memorable. He genuinely cares for the success of his students and offers SO much help outside of class. Hard work is rewarded. 10/10 would recommend!
Take him any chance you get!! Psych is already fun and he makes you want to go to long lectures. Funny and explains so clearly

Dr. Whissell is a super engaging professor who makes lectures interesting. He truly does care about his students as he provides weekly study guides in all of his courses, replies to emails quickly and is also really approachable! His testing format is also clear and straightforward so long as you study, you'll get the grade. Take his courses!!!

Dr. Whissell is one of a kind - professor at uoft. He really cares about his students and he wishes his students to success. He will answer your 200 emails a week with no problem, and he is also very accessible outside of the class. He is very reasonable when it comes to marking and lecture schedules. This is NOT a bird course - though manageable.
teacherRatingTags: ['Clear grading criteria', 'Accessible outside class', 'Gives good feedback']

rComments: Dr. Whissell is the professor that UofT needs and this course definitely proved that. He teaches very interesting topics with such clear, digest-able, and clever delivery while getting students to genuinely think critically about mindfulness and neuroscience research. Very intelligent,genuine, caring, AND down to earth - rare gem at UofT!
teacherRatingTags: ['Accessible outside class', 'Gives good feedback', 'Clear grading criteria']

rComments: Prof W. is a great professor, lecturer and human. Very friendly and caring, thoughtful and analytical, organized and diligent.

Dr. Whissell presented the content of the class in a really interesting and applicable way. His slides were cogent and concise, his tests were very fair, and the assignments were clear. He provided study guides for the midterm and a detailed outline about the final's format, which was really helpful! I definitely recommend this class!

This was a really interesting course (the content balanced biology and psychology really well) and Dr. Whissell went through the content at an excellent pace. The assignments were clear and the tests were fair! Dr. Whissell really cares about his students and it shows through the way he answers questions in class and outside.

This was an excellent course! Students had the opportunity to choose their topics for their presentations and had the chance to write a literature review, which was scaffolded incredibly well! Dr. Whissell really cares about his students, is super supportive, and is accessible outside of class! Lots of feedback was given for all assignments!
teacherRatingTags: ['Gives good feedback', 'Accessible outside class', 'Clear grading criteria']

rComments: This is my third course with Dr. W and I have to say he is THE BEST professor I ever had! He laid out information clearly on the slides and explained them thoroughly during class. The expectation was clear and the marking was fair even for the psychology course. Very nice and accessible through emails! His class is one of the "HAVE TO" at UofT!!!

EXCEPTIONAL lecturer. His lectures are very clear and easy to follow, and his style of teaching is one of my favorites (he uses simple analogies to explain difficult concepts and helps me remember). Exams and assignments are very fair, and he's always available via email and office hours. If you put in effort, you'll get the results in his courses

Dr. W is an amazing prof. He responds to emails very fast and is always available for office hours. Very approachable and truly cares about his students. I've personally had long conversations with him during office hours and I can say with confidence that he is by far the best prof at U of T. Highly recommend his classes!

Overall a great prof!! The lectures were interesting and he was very engaging and enthusiastic. The two midterm tests and one final exam were all multiple choice, though they make a lot of the questions quite difficult in the sense that you need to know each aspect taught in its entirety (all contributing factors etc.) + understanding the wording.
teacherRatingTags: ["Skip class? You won't pass.", 'Accessible outside class', 'Test heavy']

rComments: Dr. Whissell is a wonderful prof! He's very caring and super accessible outside of class for questions during office hours/over email. Lectures were always engaging and clearly explained. His slides tend to be very detailed, but it helps to attend lectures to get explanations for some of the more challenging diagrams/graphs. Overall a great dude :)
BORING!

I've taken 3 classes with Dr. W. One of the most incredible instructors at UofT - his passion for not only his field, but for teaching itself & the success of his students is so genuine and honestly unmatched. Readily available to help, offers incredible insight & feedback if you are intrinsically motivated & work hard. Truly a gem in the system

Best prof I've had in first year for sure! He is very caring and goes out of his way to help his students. The tests are very fair and only cover material from lectures and things he specifically goes over. The slides were very detailed so even if you don't go to lectures you would be fine, but I recommend going because he explains concepts well.

Super nice prof! Actually listens to student feedback. Took PSY100 in the summer and he even took out the textbook since he knows its a ton of reading for a 6-week course. Lectures aren't mandatory since he mainly reads off the slides, but they are very helpful since he explains it in a good way that helps you remember.

Dr.W was my favourite professor in my first year. He took the time out to review tests with any students who needed it and made sure to keep the class engaged by making jokes and asking questions. His course and practice questions guarantee a 70, and doing better doesn't take much more than reviewing lecture notes thoroughly.

Dr. Whissell was the most caring professor I had in first-year. He is super approachable and really timely with emails. He was thoughtful and caring regarding any assignment issues, and his lectures were very clear and interesting! Highly recommend taking a course with him.
He is such a caring professor. He's super clear, provides practice questions, and SO much support for exams and quizzes. Never had a prof this involved in a class.
Unenthusiastic, and the structure of the material is not very clear. Not saying he is a terrible instructor, but in comparison to certain professors, he is just not that good

Assignment heavy course with project proposal and two presentations. Project proposal is split into multiple smaller assignments so although there is something due almost every week, there is opportunity to improve. Dr. Whissell is VERY helpful through emails and during office hours and gives great feedback!
teacherRatingTags: ['Accessible outside class', 'Graded by few things', 'Gives good feedback']

rComments: Seems to have succumbed to the psych dept's grading requirements which is unfortunate. Lecture style wasn't for me, but that's entirely subjective. He was great in explaining methodological concepts though! Wish we had more assessments for such a small class, so that we didn't end up with a 50% final.

NEW335 combined neuroscience, medicine and mindfulness to explain the effect of mindfulness on the body. Dr. Whissell was an excellent professor who was open minded, incredibly encouraging and understanding. I remember he encouraged us to meet with him in office hours to discuss our interests in research. I highly recommend him as a professor!

The kindest&most caring professor that I've had. His evaluations, while challenging, are always fair. He is available in office hours for extra help, and supports students' learning. His grading criteria is VERY clear and he outlines exactly what he expects from students in each assignment. If you work hard in his classes, you will do well.

Seemed to be more focused on entertaining and coming off as humurous than anything else. Very unclear grading criteria - we went into the midterm exam not even knowing how much time we had to write it. Has some quizzes and provides absolutely no information on the kinds of questions to expect. Quite disappointed. No marking schemes...

Dr. Whissell is a really nice professor. He responds emails quickly and his lectures are super fun!! Will absolutely take more of his courses. Do the practice questions! And you'll surprisingly find some same questions in the exams!

He's an amazing lecturer. Hilarious, in-depth, and knowledgable. He expands on whatever he can while keeping the lecture concise, even letting us go early (PSY100). The tests are very lecture heavy (which is great, because he's such a good lecturer. Attending is important and fun), going so far as to have in-class poll results as test questions.

Dr. Whissell is as good as his reputation says! Makes lectures very interesting with well-structured slides and brings in relevant guest lecturers. Answers emails quickly, and provided study guides for midterms and exams. Overall a great professor.
Dr. Whissell is great! His lectures are fun and interesting, and he's just a really chill guy overall.

Dr. Whissell was an excellent professor! He made lectures interesting and almost always finished the 3hr class in 1&1/2hrs. He was clear as to what information would be on the tests and provided great instructions for assignments/essays. He is very caring and approachable, easy to talk to, fair with grading, and focuses on student's understanding.

I had Dr Whissell for NEW335 and thoroughly enjoyed his class. I had 0 knowledge of meditation going into the class but the class really cultivated my interest in meditation to the point that I'm currently looking to do research in the use of meditation in clinical settings! Also, he is super caring and always there for career advices!

Dr. Whissell was an incredible lecturer for my PSY396 course: Neurochemical Basis of Behaviour. His lectures were very well organized and linear. He took extremely complex material and made it interactive, accessible, and applied the material to real-world scenarios. He truly cares about his students and wants to see them succeed! Highly recommend.

Such a great prof! I found his lectures very interesting and he does a great job displaying the important information to know and provides good explanations. His lectures can be a little dry, but he does his best to keep the class engaged. If you pay attention in class (he gives hints regarding tests) and study lecture slides, it's easy to do well!
Great class, I highly suggested taking it. Make sure to do/know the study guides. His quizzes are tough so take your time and make sure to attend the lectures so you have the notes.

Dr. Whissell is very clear on what he expects students to know for tests. That being said make sure that you plan ahead and study for the final exam. The final is more challenging than the rest of the course. All lecture material is fair game (pay attention to details) and it is in your best interest to know how to apply to course content.

Professor Whissell's class was my favorite of university so far. He cares about the success of his students and is really engaging during his lectures. I recommend this class for anyone in science or just taking a breadth requirement in first year.
One of the purest and nicest profs at U of T. Tests are fair- Beware of quizzes tho those are sneaky
teacherRatingTags: ['Gives good feedback', 'Respected', "Skip class? You won't pass."]

rComments: Dr. Whissell is a great prof, he explains difficult concepts in very clear ways, and always makes sure to help you understand. This course is challenging, but you'll do well if you ask for help, which he is happy to offer! Assignments are straightforward and interesting. Tests are challenging, but not if you actually go to class and study
Saint of a man. If study, you will get a good grade.
He is a very good at explaining concepts; he simplifies a hard concept into a way that makes it easy to understand. One of the few profs that truly care about his students. Best prof at U of T.
The material is dry - but he makes it fascinating, he lectures well, and he goes out of his way to accommodate students.

The course content was interesting and Prof Whissell connected it to real life examples. He created a very welcoming environment. He really went above and beyond with making himself available to answer questions and review assignments and tests. Make sure to do the lecture review questions, they're critical for test prep.

I was Dr. Whissell's student in 2016 and was able to excel in this course because it was so intellectually engaging and stimulating. During this course, I learned the positive effects of meditation on the brain. I was deeply inspired to incorporate meditation exercises in my life and further help others who struggle with emotional dysregulation.

I don't believe in bird courses, but the reason why I would consider this course as a bird course is because Dr. Whissell makes it so easy to learn. His material is heavy, but I am always intrigued by the topics we went over. Fair marker.

Prof Whissell is my favourite professor at UofT. He is extremely approachable and caring of his students, especially during office hours/email. He offers a lot of knowledge in the material he's teaching, making his lectures engaging and interesting. I can't wait to be in his course again this winter!
Amazing professor. 3 Words: recommend, Recommend, RECOMMEND!

Prof. Whissell is super helpful, really nice, and extremely passionate about what he is teaching. This sort of dedication made learning in the class so much more enjoyable! There were times where i wasnt able to attend lectures, and I found that the slides he gave were sufficient for reviewing test content! I give him an 11/10!!

Paul Whissell is hands down the best and most caring professor I've had at UofT. Having taken PSY100 and HMB200 with him, I can say with confidence that his lectures are always clear, organized, and relevant to the topic at hand. Exams and quizzes can be a little tricky but they're always fair.

I took this course in the summer and enjoyed every lecture as Dr Whissell made them fun and engaging. A super hardworking and caring instructor who makes himself available for his students, also being willing to assist students in their journey beyond his class. Understand the concepts, remember what's necessary and you're good to go!
Nice, answers all questions and extremely responsive to emails. Fair tests and assignments.

He did a really good job of making the course interesting and informative at the same time. He is happy to answer all questions you have during office hour and answers emails very quickly. One of the best professors I have ever had!

Professor Paul Whissell is an amazing professor who I look up to. Contents of his lectures and assignments are rich and interesting, and he makes them engaging, fun, and clear. He happily explains and answers students questions. His gradings are fair and clear. He provides sincere supports and care for students to learn, improve, and succeed.

Had Paul Whissell for PSY654. Lectures were detailed and concise. The assignments were tougher but a lot of time was given to get them done. The midterm and final were both fair. Overall, the course was taught well.

Had Paul Whissell for HMB200. The material didn't get the depth it deserved but this is pretty unavoidable for an intro class. Weekly quizzes were very easy when I connected with the other students and worked through them as a group. The midterm and final were fair. Paul was great at office hours and gave me a bunch of cool articles to read!
teacherRatingTags: ['Clear grading criteria', 'Accessible outside class', 'Gives good feedback']

rComments: Had paul whissel for both PSY100 and HMB200. He is a very accessible teacher outside of class and very lenient when it comes to adjusting weekly hmb200 quiz marks up. Overall, nice guy, very VERY thick lectures. His midterm for HMB200 was straight forward and easy, exam, not so much but it was graded generously. PSY100 test and exam were hard af

Great professor. Lecture is really enjoyable. Take home quizzes are pretty tricky, but the midterm is a piece of cake. If you take PSL300 before this you should knock the course out of the park. The final is harder than the midterm for two reasons. One, the content is more difficult. Two, the questions are trickier, but not as tricky as the quiz.

Very clear lecturer and provided helpful study notes. The midterm was fair and the quizzes really encouraged you to review your notes. But beware that the final is quite challenging, he told us that the questions on the final would be in a similar style to the midterm but they were wayyy more difficult which caught many students by surprise.

Great course!! The lectures are dense but very interesting and easy to follow. The quizzes are open book, the midterm was soooo easy and the final was detailed but not that hard. Super easy compared to PSY100 and PSL300. Go to the office hours!! Prof Whissell literally spent hours answering my questions. Great with email as well!

Dr. Whissell was one of the best profs I had in UofT. Just finished the final, it wasn't that bad. The midterm was super easy so we all expected a tough final. He had a ton of office hours leading up to the exam and answered my billion emails.

This is an introductory course but he demonstrated that it can also be as hard and detailed as advanced courses. He didnt test us on big and general concepts in the final exam but small tiny details instead. Anatomy terms are frequently tested, and of course, spelling counts. He absolutely redefined introductory course.

Weekly quizzes were unnecessary unclear, midterms were fair and his lectures are just pretty much rephrasing the information found on the slide. Rambling on at certain periods of lecture and tests material that he did not teach in class in the weekly quizzes.

Funny, approachable, open-minded, caring, interesting. He evaluates critically what is best for students instead of following the "typical professor" mould; he fosters a close relationship with students; he always tries to relate content matter back to students.
Amazing prof, interesting content in HMB200- challenging questions in the tutorial quizzes but helps prepare for midterm/final!
Best teacher I have ever had at UofT. Doesn't require a textbook for this class and engages the audience extremely well.

Highly recommend!! Dr. Whissell is very enthusiastic & passionate about concepts he teaches. His lectures are easy to follow, straightforward and well-organized. He posts exam study questions (very helpful!), is great at inspiring students to take interest in the subject and is always willing to elaborate on concepts you want to learn more about.

Dr. Whissell is definitely one of my favourite professors at UofT. He was entertaining, great at explaining content and answering questions. It was clear Dr. Whissell cares about his students; he went over assignments thoroughly, provided study guides, and made himself available outside of class. I highly recommend taking Dr. Whissell's courses.
best prof ever!!!!! absolutely loved him!!!

He is an amazing professor! He truly cares about his students (also doesnt require textbook because its too expensive) and gives you all the help you need in order to succeed in his course. Be prepared to work hard, even though midterms and final are based on lectures solely you still need pay attention in class. Hes a refreshing young prof.
This class is an easy 4.0, especially if you're interested in the subject! If not, it can be quite tedious, seeing by the amount of people that elected not to take part II of this course.

Great lectures, very knowledgeable about behavioral genetics. Marks fairly and provides clear expectations for grading. Provides helpful study guides before tests and exams. Easy to approach, really funny and cares about students. I would definitely recommend Professor Whissell's class to anyone

Dr. Whissell gives excellent lectures that are informative and concise. Marks fairly, clearly lays out what he expects from students on assignments & tests. He cares about his students doing well and provides opportunities that help students succeed. Made learning behavioral genetics interesting and fun :) thank you Prof Whissell (P.S. v spicy ��)

I definitely would recommend taking any course with Dr. Whissell! I am in his New One course and absolutely love attending class every week. The class is particularly small so there is a lot of interesting discussion throughout. The assignments are not overwhelmingly difficult, and he is a fair marker. You can tell he wants his students to succeed!

Would 10/10 recommend taking his New One course both in the fall and winter semester. The class is small which allows for great discussions on the lecture topics and the course load is not heavy at all. The best thing is, though, that he gives deadline extensions without us even having to us!

I love this prof so much! One of my most favorites. Never got tired or sleepy in any of the lectures. Love how he responds to emails as quickly as possible. He delivers concepts in such a neat way...I love it. Studying was definitely enjoyable (thanks to the study guides he makes).

I loved this class! If you know your slides, the tests are fairly straightforward. The difficulty of the final exam is more than the midterm so make sure you keep up with the work throughout the semester. He was fast in answering emails and helped me a lot to make sure my grades were good. He was also very approachable during class!

Dr. Whissell is an easy to approach professor. For this course, his lecture slides are sufficient enough for you to grasp the main idea as well as essential details about the course. The challenge is that if you take his course during the summer session, each lecture would cover so many things that you may find overwhelming in the beginning.

Amazing professor. His lectures are very clear, organized, interesting& relevant to course material. Great approach to sensitive topics. His exams were fair. He's also very approachable & easy to talk to about anything (course related+personal)! He gives great, honest advice & cares for his students. I encourage everyone to take PSY100 with him!

Dr. Whissell presented the topic as interesting and essential. He demonstrated courage in the classroom addressing difficult topics. He is organized, professional, is clear on boundaries and definitely has a passion for the subject matter.  He was able to inspire many of us to love and respect Psychology. As my first class in 35years, I am grateful

Truly cares about his students, and is very passionate about teaching. On a scale of 1-10, his class is at an 11 (not exaggerating?). Even if you're not into psychology, taking it with him might change your mind.   * this is not an ad. I actually spent time filling out his course evals, because he's that awesome.

Paul Whissell was a great professor. Really organized, lectures were not boring, very clear. Exams and tests were fair, even easy (don't tell him though so he keeps making them easy). Has office hours, easy to talk to, replied to emails super quick. Would recommend taking any courses with him!!!

REALLY LOVE PAUL WHISSELL. He has a deep passion in this field. I love how he was really accessible in person AND in email (replies back really soon). Very friendly and approachable, and you can see he truly cares about the success of his students. I'd totally take any class that he teaches in the future. Lectures are not boring!!!

Paul Whissell is deeply passionate, enthusiastic, dedicated, and critical about his work- and this shows in the quality of his lectures and his dedication to his teaching and to the students in his courses. He is very accessible for questions, concerns, or discussions regarding course material, and he makes his grading criteria very clear.

Prof Whissell is one of the best professors i have had. His interest in the field was evident which made his lectures interesting and engaging. Plus i loved the pop culture references in class. He was also super approachable and easily accessible via email. The best thing though was the fact that he made it clear about what to expect on the exams.

Paul is a fantastic professor in my Meditation & the Body course and he did an excellent job in elucidating concepts through a strong neuroscience perspective. This course was one of my more interesting and enjoyable courses. Paul was also very approachable and accessible in answering questions and providing feedback.

Paul taught my Meditation & the Body course & as someone else commented, he was a 'breath of fresh air' in comparison to other professors. He was very attentive, open to answering any questions, went above& beyond to make himself available to clarify material & overall had very interesting & captivating lectures! 100% recommend taking his course(s)

Great professor! Really enjoyed his class. His lectures are clearly organized and well explained. He outlines his expectations from you for tests and assignments beforehand and is always available for help/guidance! TAKE HIS CLASS, you will not regret it! :)
He was such a breath of fresh air compared to other courses and professors. He explained things nicely, was willing to help at all times, and material was very interesting!

Had him for Meditation & the Body. It was awesome! Wasn't expecting the course to be so science-y but he made it fun and easy to understand. His lectures are awesome and he's actually really helpful! Only downside of the guy is that he's a blue jays fan, but nobody's perfect

One of the best profs at UofT!! I really enjoyed his lectures - clear, organized, easy to follow. He's quirky and kinda funny in a dorky way.  He was also super accessible and answered emails right away!  I would love to have him again.
